Image 8 of 8 Sun Valley Lodge reopening 1 / 8 Back to Gallery gallery_thumbs_close|article-gallery-6414047|article-gallery-6414047|0 gallery_overlay_close|article-gallery-6414047|article-gallery-6414047|0 Hotel reopening
Idaho: After a nine-month renovation, Sun Valley Lodge in the eponymous resort has greatly expanded the size of its luxurious rooms by shrinking their number, from 148 to 94. The new, 20,000-square-foot spa provides 15 treatment rooms, salon, yoga studio, fitness center and heated saline pool. From $409. www.sunvalley.com/lodging.
New tour
France: Inspired by the Tour de France, Cycling House’s new weeklong French Alps tour covers 50-80 miles daily from its base in Annecy, including Alpe d’Huez and other iconic climbs. Riders depart Sept. 1 and 9; from $2,895. www.thecyclinghouse.com.
Ecotourism
Ecuador: Enjoy a homestay, join in craft and food making, and hike on pre-Incan trails through cloud forest with diverse flora and fauna in Yunguilla, an hour outside of Quito. The community’s 52 participating families share the proceeds. www.yunguilla.org.ec.
New retreat
Morocco: Yogascapes,
a yoga/adventure travel company, will host a retreat at the Fellah Hotel, a wellness oasis in Marrakesh with an on-site farm and spa. The seven-day trip, departing Nov. 15, includes cultural excursions; from $2,099. www.yogascapes.com .
World heritage
China: UNESCO has inscribed the Tusi sites, named for the centuries-long rule that allowed ethnic minorities in the mountainous southwest to preserve their culture, on its World Heritage list. Among them is Tangya Tusi, which boasts the Laosicheng temple complex and the Hailongtun stairway. http://whc.unesco.org.
